intro: Lindernia brennanii, commonly known as the Brennan's lindernia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Linderniaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tubular, violet to blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or swampy areas. Lindernia brennanii is a perennial herb that is relatively easy to grow in gardens with the right conditions.
